circumstances: The pilot initiated the approach to Newark Airport in marginal weather conditions (heavy rain falls). On final, he failed to realize his altitude was insufficient when the airplane crashed onto a natural gas storage tank located in Elizabeth, few miles short of runway 04L threshold. The aircraft was totally destroyed and all four occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
Ground collision during initial approach caused by the combination of the following factors:
- The pilot-in-command failed to follow the approved procedures, 
- Improper IFR operation on part of the pilot-in-command,
- Instruments misread or failed to read, 
- Obstructions to vision, 
- Rain,
- No second pilot on board, 
- Descended below glide slope on an ILS approach to runway 04L.
